apiSettings.title: API Key Management
apiSettings.apiKeys: YouTube Data API v3 Keys (one per line)
apiSettings.infoText: Your API keys are stored locally in your browser. Get keys from the Google Cloud Console.

optimization.title: Quota Optimization Settings
optimization.infoText: Adjust these settings to control quota usage. Higher values provide more comprehensive results but use more quota. Lower values save quota but may return fewer results.

apiGuide.title: How to Get a YouTube API Key

step1.title: Go to Google Cloud Console
step1.instruction1: Open your web browser and go to the Google Cloud Console.
step1.instruction2: Sign in with your Google account (create one if you don't have it).
step1.instruction3: If you're new to Google Cloud, you may need to accept the terms of service.

step2.title: Create a New Project
step2.instruction1: Click on the project dropdown at the top of the page.
step2.instruction3: Enter a name for your project (e.g., 'YouTube API Project').
step2.instruction4: Click 'Create' to create your new project.

step3.title: Enable YouTube Data API v3
step3.instruction1: In the left sidebar, click on 'APIs & Services' > 'Library'.
step3.instruction2: In the search bar, type 'YouTube Data API v3'.
step3.instruction3: Click on the YouTube Data API v3 card that appears in the search results.
step3.instruction4: On the API page, click the 'Enable' button.
step3.instruction5: Wait for the API to be enabled for your project.

step4.title: Create API Credentials
step4.instruction1: After enabling the API, click on 'Create Credentials' button.
step4.instruction2: In the form that appears, select 'YouTube Data API v3' for the API and 'Web browser (JavaScript)' for the application type.
step4.instruction3: Click 'What credentials do I need?' and follow the prompts to create an API key.
step4.note: Your new API key will be displayed. Make sure to copy it as you'll need it for this application.

step5.title: Add the API Key to This Application
step5.instruction1: Copy your new API key to the clipboard.
step5.instruction2: Paste it into the API key field above and click 'Save & Validate Keys'.
step5.note: Each API key has a daily quota limit of 10,000 units. Different API operations consume different amounts of quota. For most users, this is sufficient for personal use.
